comment.body: Fiat currencies work fine. They are based on confidence, but there is nothing wrong with that. Don't forget that Bitcoin is also a fiat currency, and also based on confidence.
@Zerg: That's not what defines a fiat currency. A fiat currency is one that doesn't have an intrinsic value. Bitcoin doesn't. It only has value because we believe it does.
@Zerg: It's also false that this is what we're doing with every fiat currency. Regular currency isn't just created indefinitely. In the Euro Area, inflation is kept at 2%.

@Zerg: Inflation rate correlates not only with the amount of money printed but mostly by the amount of money in circulation. A lot of money that is printed isn't circulating, and a lot of money that isn't printed _is_ circulating.
